items.title: All Terrain
items.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

items.title: All Season
items.description: Most common: Good handle on dry, wet or snow

items.title: Highway
items.description: Highway terrain tires are commonly used on light trucks and SUVs that typically haul materials or need to conquer highways and some off-road terrains.

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

items.title: Performance
items.description: For sport/luxury vehicles and high-speed handling

items.title: Summer
items.description: For dry roads and warm, arid climates

items.title: All Weather
items.description: Combines an All Season and Winter tire traits for strong traction year-round

content.body:
### Shop 255/65R17 Tire Size The 225/65R17 tire size is something you’ll see mainly on trucks, crossovers and SUVs like the Nissan Frontier, Nissan Pathfinder, Ford F150, Chevrolet Colorado and Ford Ranger. All-season tires are the single biggest selling category of tires in the United States thanks to their predictable handling, forgiving ride, low noise and year-round traction, even in light snow. For most drivers of these trucks and crossovers, all-season tires make perfect sense; check out premium 255/65R17 tires like the Michelin Defender LTX M/S, Continental CrossContact LX20, Firestone Destination LE3, and [Nitto Crosstek 2](https://simpletire.com/brands/nitto-tires/crosstek-2). Popular vehicles: 2020-2021 Nissan Frontier
2005-2014 Nissan Pathfinder
2004-2014 Ford F150
2012-2021 Chevrolet Colorado
2019-2021 Ford Ranger For drivers that like to take their ride off-road, all-terrain tires are a great balance of traction and toughness for mud, rocks and sand while still offering good road manners on the highway. For all-terrain tires in 225/65R17 size, we’d suggest tires like the BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2, Falken Wildpeak A/T3W, [Yokohama Geolandar A/T G015](https://simpletire.com/brands/yokohama-tires/geolandar-a-t-g015), and Hankook Dynapro AT2 (RF11). Highway terrain tires are similar to all-season tires in that they allow for strong traction and performance year-round. The difference, though, is that highway terrain tires are typically stronger to help drivers haul and tow materials, boats, and trailers, while also offering slightly better off-road performance. Check out the [Bridgestone Dueler H/T 685](https://simpletire.com/brands/bridgestone-tires/dueler-h-t-685), Toyo Open Country H/T II, General Grabber HTS60, and Kumho Crugen HT51 if you’re looking for a set of 255/65R17 highway terrain tires for your light truck or SUV. Whether you drive a Chevrolet Colorado, Ford Ranger, Nissan Pathfinder, or something else, SimpleTire has a set of 255/65R17 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
